name: Idiopathic Mesenteric Panniculitis
chief_complaint: Severe abdominal pain that comes and goes, with nausea and weight loss
symptoms: unintentional weight loss (15 lbs in 2 months)
physical_findings: palpable mesenteric mass in right lower quadrant

lab_results.CT abdomen: fat stranding and soft tissue density in mesentery with 'misty mesentery' appearance

treatment: total parenteral nutrition during acute flares
prognosis: Chronic relapsing-remitting course with 30% requiring long-term immunosuppression. Rare progression to mesenteric fibrosis.
description: A rare inflammatory condition affecting the mesenteric fat tissue of unknown etiology. Characterized by chronic inflammation, fat necrosis, and fibrosis that may mimic malignancy. Often requires surgical biopsy for definitive diagnosis.
